posts.title: The Rust Bucket Begins
posts.author: Francis the car Doctor
posts.content: Today marks the first step of my journey restoring a 1984 Toyota Land Cruiser. It's been sitting in my dad's shed for years, covered in dust and rust. The engine doesn’t start, and the body has seen better days, but I'm determined to bring it back to life. Let the teardown begin!

posts.title: Engine Overhaul Weekend
posts.author: Francis the car Doctor
posts.content: Spent the entire weekend in the garage. Removed the old engine block — heavy as hell! Replaced piston rings, cleaned the valves, and swapped in a new camshaft. I documented everything with pictures and labeled each part meticulously. The goal: clean start and no leftover bolts!

posts.title: Paint, Polish, and Pride
posts.author: Francis the car Doctor
posts.content: Bodywork is DONE! After hours of sanding, priming, and painting, the old Land Cruiser is now a shining forest green. Clear coat went on smoothly and gave it a nice gloss. It's amazing to see it slowly transforming from a wreck to a road-worthy machine.

posts.title: Interior works
posts.author: Francis the car Doctor
posts.content: working on the interior of the car

posts.title: Sound system and cool gadgets
posts.author: Francis the car Doctor
posts.content: Pimping the sound of our car. New speakers including a subwoofer and a new stereo with display functionalities
